alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Princeton, or 19 miles west of Calais, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Calais, Perry, Princeton, Meddybemps, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Charlotte, Baring, Cooper, Crawford, and Big Lake. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 near Calais. State Highway 9 between Crawford and Calais. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
